page.title: 07Allenton Market, Derby
page.content: Allenton Market is an open air market with a covering roof over about fifty permanent stalls. These have wooden tops and legs which hold up both the table tops and the corrugated roofs. It is open on Fridays and Saturdays when it sells groceries, shoes, fruit and vegetables, clothes and toys.Most people shop here instead of the nearby shops because the market is much cheaper. On Tuesday nights there is a{Flea {Market,}which is like a huge jumble sale. People take second-hand clothes, furniture, toys etc. Some traders bring their own tables and things on Tuesdays because there isn't enough room on the ordinary tables for all their goods.
